description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6oq3j","text":"A protocol for extracting RNA from Aiptasia, modified from the Weis lab protocol by Angela Poole and Mauricio Rodriguez-Lanetty. Note that the final product has significant DNA contamination and needs to be cleaned up via DNase treatment. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98ngr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
before_start: Make sure to setup a clean area in the fume hood, wipe down all pipettes with RNase Away/Zap, and cool down the centrifuge.
warning: All Trizol steps should be performed in the hood. All Trizol waste should be treated as hazardous.
protocol_affiliation: University of Pennsylvania,Berry College,Oregon State University
manuscript_citation: Rodriguez-Lanetty, M., Phillips, W.S., Weis, V.M., 2006. Transcriptome analysis of a cnidarian-dinoflagellate mutualism reveals complex modulation of host gene expression. BMC Genomics 7, 23. doi:10.1186/1471-2164-7-23
authors: Kelsey Speer,Angela Poole,modified from Weis lab protocol by Mauricio Rodriguez-Lanetty

authors_list.name: modified from Weis lab protocol by Mauricio Rodriguez-Lanetty

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bfib","text":"Centrifuge samples for 10 minutes at 12,000 x g at 4\u00b0C. This step will pellet any debris and polysaccharides. Transfer the supernatant to a new tube and discard the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7D5903B723B84BF29C612F248A40670D","id":655593,"previous_id":655592,"previous_guid":"867830AB5E464F1AAE6E462F169EB21D","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsl5n","text":"Add chloroform to the sample (0.2 mL per 1 mL of Trizol used) and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Incubate samples at room temperature for 2-3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"09B5797E384D416A9F70E2D74A898153","id":655594,"previous_id":655593,"previous_guid":"7D5903B723B84BF29C612F248A40670D","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fq4ou","text":"Centrifuge samples for 18 minutes at 10,000 x g at 4\u00b0C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43nfu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c1qbr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"apm1r","text":"*Note: past this step you should be careful of RNase contamination*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"D99F7A667B8F459AB29298256B78A9C6","id":655595,"previous_id":655594,"previous_guid":"09B5797E384D416A9F70E2D74A898153","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm6vn","text":"Carefully remove the top aqueous (clear) layer and transfer to a new sterile, RNase-free tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dq0ls","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"846am","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"4pnag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72n72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"b6ub6","text":"IMPORTANT: When you take your samples out of the centrifuge, you will see three layers: aqueous (clear, top), interphase (white, middle) and organic (red, bottom). Stay away from the white middle layer - that is where the DNases and RNases are. It is better to leave a little of the aqueous layer behind than to risk contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"92893842EE434F36A926C2FBC41BEC7E","id":655596,"previous_id":655595,"previous_guid":"D99F7A667B8F459AB29298256B78A9C6","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3scom","text":"Slowly add an equal volume of 100% RNase-free EtOH and mix gently by pipetting or inverting tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"bold"},{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F4817346A8954739AE7A82CB15B3E0DA","id":655597,"previous_id":655596,"previous_guid":"92893842EE434F36A926C2FBC41BEC7E","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buh0a","text":"Load sample (up to 700 \u03bcL) into an RNeasy spin column (Qiagen) and spin at room temperature for 1 min at 8,000 x g. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"45gn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"37k7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"54jrf","text":"If your total volume exceeds 700 \u03bcL, repeat this step until all of the sample has passed over the column. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"F3F7D94FCE244B509AE1D0029EE6C325","id":655598,"previous_id":655597,"previous_guid":"F4817346A8954739AE7A82CB15B3E0DA","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gdtm","text":"Add 700 \u03bcl of Buffer RW1 to the column and spin at room temperature for 1 min at 8,000 x g. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"641B6C90296A4E2F94EED80E59FFBA6E","id":655599,"previous_id":655598,"previous_guid":"F3F7D94FCE244B509AE1D0029EE6C325","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v2kh","text":"Transfer spin column to a new collection tube and add 500 \u03bcl of Buffer RPE (check that ethanol has been added) and spin at room temperature for 1 min at 8,000 x g. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"54F39B9CB6E1470086003E45556E6C46","id":655600,"previous_id":655599,"previous_guid":"641B6C90296A4E2F94EED80E59FFBA6E","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p7ap","text":"Add 500 \u03bcl of Buffer RPE and spin at room temperature for 2 min at 8,000 x g. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"17ED6C67A4F5492FB97D78931CE62E2C","id":655601,"previous_id":655600,"previous_guid":"54F39B9CB6E1470086003E45556E6C46","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28csc","text":"Spin for an additional 1 minute at 8,000 x g to get rid of remaining buffer in column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"11EB280704B14703A6EA6F23F7043ABD","id":655602,"previous_id":655601,"previous_guid":"17ED6C67A4F5492FB97D78931CE62E2C","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbfjo","text":"Transfer the spin column to a new, RNase-free 1.5 mL collection tube and pipette 30-50 \u03bcl of RNase-free water over the center of the membrane (do not touch the membrane with your pipette tip!). Let the sample sit at room temperature for 1 minute and then spin for 1 minute at 8,000 x g to elute RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"204C132719734A3986F7E48911C4E770","id":655603,"previous_id":655602,"previous_guid":"11EB280704B14703A6EA6F23F7043ABD","section":""}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bt0jc","text":"Discard the spin column and store your RNA at -80\u00b0C until further use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"520C0C9345CE4629BAB300BB72B01E5C","id":655604,"previous_id":655603,"previous_guid":"204C132719734A3986F7E48911C4E770","section":""}
